intro: Hedeoma longiflora, commonly known as long-flowered hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. Hedeoma longiflora is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and wetlands.
